text: Don't go to a museum with a destination. Museums are wormholes to other worlds. They are ecstasy machines. Follow your eyes to wherever they lead you…and the world should begin to change for you.
author: Jerry Saltz

text: The best introduction to art is to stroll through a museum. The more art you see, the more you'll learn to define your own taste.
author: Jeanne Frank

text: It's not a museum. It's not a place of artifacts; it's a place of ideas.
author: Jeanie Kahnke

text: A museum is a place where one should lose one's head.
author: Renzo Piano

text: A museum has to renew its collection to be alive, but that does not mean we give on important old works.
author: David Rockefeller

text: A visit to a museum is a search for beauty, truth, and meaning in our lives. Go to museums as often as you can.
author: Maira Kalman

text: The only way to understand painting is to go and look at it. And if out of a million visitors there is even one to whom art means something, that is enough to justify museums.
author: Pierre-Auguste Renoir

text: …That's why we have the Museum, Matty, to remind us of how we came, and why: to start fresh, and begin a new place from what we had learned and carried from the old.
author: Lois Lowry

text: I love doing normal things … I also love to go to art and history museums.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: A painting in a museum probably hears more foolish remarks than anything else in the world.
author: Edmond De Goncourt

text: Nobody ever flunked a science museum.
author: Frank Oppenheimer

text: Murals in restaurants are on a par with the food in museums.
author: Peter De Vries

text: Give me a museum and I'll fill it.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: When you think about it, department stores are kind of like museums.
author: Andy Warhol

text: I paint flowers so they will not die.
author: Frida Kahlo
